alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Franklin; Mercer; Nelson; Shelby; Spencer (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SPENCER... SOUTHEASTERN SHELBY...NORTHEASTERN NELSON...NORTHWESTERN MERCER... ANDERSON AND SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 701 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Shelbyville to 9 miles southeast of Taylorsville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Frankfort, Lawrenceburg, Ballard, Wayside, Anderson City, Glensboro, Farmdale, Johnsonville, Avenstoke and Ashbrook. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Franklin; Mercer; Nelson; Shelby; Spencer
